meanings.definition: Neat and tidy; in good order.
meanings.sent1: The sailor's bunk was shipshape, with neatly folded blankets and pillows.
meanings.sent2: She always keeps her room shipshape by organizing her books and toys.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to make the messy yarn basket shipshape by rearranging the threads.
meanings.sent4: After the storm, the garden looked shipshape again with the flowers standing tall.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was shipshape, with desks lined up perfectly and the whiteboard clean.

meanings.definition: To put in order; tidy up.
meanings.sent1: He needed to shipshape his desk before starting his homework.
meanings.sent2: They decided to shipshape the garage by organizing the tools and equipment.
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to shipshape their playroom by putting away their toys.
meanings.sent4: She managed to shipshape the chaotic closet by arranging the clothes by color.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to shipshape the kitchen before the health inspector arrived.
